block.p: Debt * Bank of Boston Corp. is selling $350 million 6.625 percent subordinated notes due in 2005 priced at 99.63 to yield 6.67 percent through underwriters led by Merrill Lynch. The noncallable notes are rated Baa-2 by Moody's Investors Service and triple-B by Standard & Poor's and Duff Phelps.

Debt * Bank of Boston Corp. is selling $350 million 6.625 percent subordinated notes due in 2005 priced at 99.63 to yield 6.67 percent through underwriters led by Merrill Lynch. The noncallable notes are rated Baa-2 by Moody's Investors Service and triple-B by Standard & Poor's and Duff Phelps.

* Federal Home Loan Bank is selling $450 million of notes divided into two parts: $250 million of notes due in 1994 priced at 100 to yield 3.58 percent and $200 million notes due in 1995 priced at 100 to yield 4.08 percent, both through Merrill Lynch. The notes are noncallable.

Preferred Stock * San Diego Gas and Electric Co. is selling 640,000 of cumulative preferred stock priced at $26 a share to yield 7 percent through Merrill Lynch. The noncallable five-year shares are rated A-1 by Moody's and A by S.& P. and Duff & Phelps.
